mechanics.condition: Target is a visible creature made of flesh within range
mechanics.outcome: Target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is restrained. On a successful save, it is unaffected.

mechanics.condition: Creature is currently restrained by Flesh to Stone
mechanics.outcome: Creature must make another Constitution saving throw. Successes and failures are tracked.

mechanics.condition: Creature has accumulated 3 failed Constitution saving throws against Flesh to Stone (not necessarily consecutive)
mechanics.outcome: Creature is subjected to the petrified condition for the spell's duration.

mechanics.condition: Creature has accumulated 3 successful Constitution saving throws against Flesh to Stone (not necessarily consecutive)
mechanics.outcome: The spell ends for that creature.

mechanics.trigger: Creature suffers physical damage while petrified by this spell
mechanics.condition: Creature is currently petrified by Flesh to Stone AND takes physical damage
mechanics.outcome: If the creature later reverts to its original state, it suffers similar deformities corresponding to the physical damage taken while petrified.

mechanics.trigger: Caster maintains concentration for the entire possible duration
mechanics.condition: Caster maintains concentration on Flesh to Stone for the maximum possible duration
mechanics.outcome: The creature is permanently turned to stone until the effect is removed by other magic.

description_text: You attempt to turn one creature that you can see within range into stone. If the target's body is made of flesh, the creature must make a constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is restrained as its flesh begins to harden. On a successful save, the creature isn't affected. A creature restrained by this spell must make another constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails its saves three times, it is turned to stone and subjected to the petrified condition for the duration. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind. If the creature is physically broken while petrified, it suffers from similar deformities if it reverts to its original state. If you maintain your concentration on this spell for the entire possible duration, the creature is turned to stone until the effect is removed.
